column4: is breezy already stable? Because I haven't seen any updates for a wile!!!!
SO WHY CANT I GET MY NVIDIA WORKING !!???
and where's the gui startup screen they promised?
what did you do to try to get it working?
installed nvidia-glx and changed my driver from nv to nvidia
do no dowload from nvidia
install linux-restricted-modules
theres no package called linux-restricted-modules
yes there is. it's in the restricted repository
oh let me look at my sources.list
oh interesting, when I dist-upgraded to breezy, it recommented it out!!
you're on breezy, right?
yes
then it will be there as soon as you click Reload
wat do I do once restricted modules is installed ?
install linux-restricted-modules-686 then
once it's installed, you can dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg to select fglrx
isn't fglrx for ati ??
sorry, nvidia, not fglrx
or I can just edit my xorg.conf, no?
editing xorg.conf manually tends to mess up debconf
yes
linux-restricted-modules should include both legacy and nonlegacy
thank you very much. all is working. I needed nvidia-glx-legacy instead of nvidia-glx, because I'm using an old TNT2 card.
